events.title: Germany Declares War on Russia
events.description: At the outset of World War I, Germany declared war on Russia, marking the escalation of the conflict in Europe.
events.significance: This declaration led to a full-scale war involving many world powers, fundamentally altering global politics and societies.

events.title: Joseph Priestley Discovers Oxygen
events.description: Joseph Priestley, an English chemist, discovered oxygen, a vital element for life and combustion.
events.significance: This discovery advanced the field of chemistry and laid the groundwork for modern scientific understanding of gases and respiration.

events.title: Burkina Faso Gains Independence
events.description: Upper Volta, now known as Burkina Faso, gained independence from French colonial rule on this date.
events.significance: The country's independence marked a significant step in the wave of decolonization across Africa, influencing political dynamics on the continent.

events.title: First Launch of the Space Shuttle Columbia
events.description: NASA launched the first space shuttle, Columbia, on its maiden voyage, marking a new era in reusable spacecraft technology.
events.significance: This event symbolized a leap forward in space exploration technology, allowing for more frequent and cost-effective missions.

events.title: Slavery Abolished in the British Empire
events.description: The Slavery Abolition Act came into effect, legally freeing all slaves in the British Empire.
events.significance: This act was a major milestone in human rights, setting precedent for the eventual global abolition of slavery.
